content: Medical association based in SingaporeThe topic of this article **may not meet Wikipedia's notability guidelines for companies and organizations**. Please help to demonstrate the notability of the topic by citing reliable secondary sources that are independent of the topic and provide significant coverage of it beyond a mere trivial mention. If notability cannot be shown, the article is likely to be merged, redirected, or deleted. *Find sources:* "Singapore Medical Association" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Singapore Medical Association** (abbreviated **SMA**) is a non-governmental, not-for-profit [professional association](/wiki/Professional_association) representing the medical professionals in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was established on September 15, 1959, replacing the [Malaya](/wiki/Federation_of_Malaya) Branch of the [British Medical Association](/wiki/British_Medical_Association). As of March 2025, it had over 10,835 members. It publishes the monthly SMA Newsletter and [peer-reviewed](/wiki/Peer-review) *[Singapore Medical Journal](/wiki/Singapore_Medical_Journal)*. - [Australian Medical Association](/wiki/Australian_Medical_Association) (AMA) - [British Medical Association](/wiki/British_Medical_Association) (BMA) - Official website of SMA
title: Singapore Medical Association
